postsData.name:
Nerea Arregui Exposito
Nerea Arregui Exposito
postsData.content:
How AI is revolutionizing software development at Mchange 

At Mchange, we’re leveraging AI tools to transform how we approach software development.

The result? Streamlined workflows, smarter collaboration, and measurable outcomes.

Here’s an example about how to  bridge expert insights and practical implementation with AI

️Start with the right resources.
→Choose impactful content, like “Scaling Microservices” or “DevOps Best Practices.”
→Use transcription tools (e.g.,) to convert videos into actionable text.

️Extract actionable insights.
→ Upload transcripts into an AI-powered research assistant  ( e.g. NotebookLM)
→Summarize key takeaways to uncover patterns and practical applications.

️Brainstorm applications tailored to our needs.
Ask strategic questions:
→"How can we improve our CI/CD pipeline with these insights?"
→"Based on this what’s the best architecture for integrating microservices into our platform?"
→"What’s our roadmap for adopting these practices?"

️Move from theory to code.
→ Turn insights into implementation by asking NotebookLM to generate working code.
Example: Automating CI/CD processes or prototyping microservice integrations.

️Collaborate, plan, and document.
→Facilitate discussions.
→Create tutorials, task lists, or diagrams to preserve and share knowledge.

Why does this work for us?

Enhancedsimplifies complex choices.
Seamless integration. We combine the best practices with real-world applications.
Sustainable innovation. Continuous learning leads to continuous improvement.

Curious about how AI tools can accelerate your workflows? DM me or visit our website

comments.commentText: Love how you're integrating AI to streamline development processes. NotebookLM's application for code generation is particularly intriguing.
Amr shalan Appreciate that, Amr!

Amr shalan congrats ..
 Aid my growth by following sir

Wow, this is really fascinating! I love how Mchange is leveraging AI tools to streamline software development workflows and improve collaboration. The idea of using transcription tools to convert videos into actionable text is brilliant, and the AI-powered research assistant sounds like a game-changer for extracting actionable insights. It's also great to see how Mchange is using AI to generate working code and facilitate discussions.

Shahdin Salman🇵🇸 Thank you! At Mchange, we see AI as a way to enhance efficiency and innovation rather than just automate tasks. Leveraging AI for transcription, research, and code generation allows teams to focus on creativity and problem-solving. Glad you found it fascinating!

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting insights! Its inspiring to see how AI is reshaping development workflows at Mchange. Looking forward to more innovative practices! 🚀

postsData.name:
Fatou Seck Mathon
Fatou Seck Mathon
postsData.content:
Losing your job doesn’t make you worthless. 

A layoff, a toxic workplace, or a big failure shakes your self-confidence.

You question yourself, doubting your abilities and feeling stuck.

I have been there.

But confidence isn't something you wait to feel again.

Take these actions to rebuild it, one step at a time.

 Reframe the setback.
↳ This wasn't the end of your story; it's part of your growth.
↳ Write down 3 lessons you've learned from this experience.

 Change the narrative in your head.
↳ Catch yourself when self-doubt creeps in.
↳ Replace negative with positive self-talk.

 Reconnect with what makes you feel strong.
↳ What activity used to bring you joy? Start doing it again.
↳ Small wins build momentum; celebrate them.

 Surround yourself with the right people.
↳ Spend time with those who uplift you.
↳ Distance yourself from those who feed your doubts.

 Take action before you feel ready.
↳ Confidence follows action, not the other way around.
↳ Start small, send that email, make that call, and take that step.

Confidence isn't about never falling.

It's about knowing you can rise again.

What's one thing you do daily to protect your self-confidence?

Repost to help someone rebuild their confidence.
Followfor more.

comments.commentText: Love this Fatou Seck. Losing a job is just a detour in the path to your next chapter.
comments.userName: Damesha Craig, Leadership Coach and Startup Advisor

postsData.commentAdded: This is such a powerful reminder! Building confidence takes time, but each small step makes a big difference. Lets lift each other up! 💪✨

postsData.name:
Jeff Roberts
Jeff Roberts
postsData.content:
Imagine transforming hours of painstaking video editing into a process that takes just minutes. According to a recent New York Post article, creators leveraging AI tools are achieving exactly that—streamlining tasks like video editing, scriptwriting, and graphic design.

By using AI, creators who once spent days perfecting a video can now get it done in a fraction of the time. That efficiency allows them to innovate and scale, producing more content without sacrificing quality.

But with this level of automation, the challenge becomes preserving the unique, human touch that resonates with audiences.

The question is: How do we strike a balance between embracing tools that save time and ensuring the authenticity of what we create?

Read more on the New York Post:
postsData.commentAdded: This is a game-changer! Embracing AI tools can boost creativity, but maintaining authenticity is key. Lets find that perfect balance!

postsData.content:
𝗦𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 $𝟱𝟳𝟬𝗞 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗛𝗶𝗶𝗕𝗼

𝗪𝗲’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝘁 𝗛𝗶𝗶𝗕𝗼 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵—𝗮𝗻 𝗔𝗜 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗴𝗲𝗻𝘂𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮 𝗳𝗿𝗶𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗟𝗟𝗠-𝘀𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿—𝘀𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗿𝗲 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗰𝗸 𝗿𝗲-𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝗳𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗺𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲𝘀. 𝗢𝘂𝗿 𝗣𝗢𝗖 𝗶𝘀 𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲 (𝗳𝗲𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗲𝗹𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁) 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝘄𝗲’𝗿𝗲 𝗿𝗮𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 $𝟱𝟳𝟬𝗞 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗶𝘀𝗵 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘄𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗱: 𝗮 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆 𝗹𝗮𝘆𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝘁𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗽𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗔𝗜 𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲, 𝗸𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝘅𝘁, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗹 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗮.

𝗪𝗵𝘆 $𝟱𝟳𝟬𝗞?

 𝗘𝘅𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘃 𝘁𝗲𝗮𝗺 𝘁𝗼 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝗯𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝗿𝘁- 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴-𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗺 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗼𝗿𝘆.

 𝗣𝗼𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗟𝗟𝗠 𝘀𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘂𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗹 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝘀𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀.

 𝗕𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗼𝗻 𝗺𝗮𝗿𝗸𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴/𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘄𝗲’𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝘁.

𝗜𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗯𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘃𝗲 𝗔𝗜 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘂𝘀—𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗮𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱—𝗹𝗲𝘁’𝘀 𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗸. 𝗖𝗵𝗲𝗰𝗸 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹𝘀 𝗼𝗿 𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝗲 𝗱𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗹𝘆.

postsData.name:
Ashish Misal
Ashish Misal
postsData.content:
Interviewer: How would you optimize the performance of the web application?

1. Minimize HTTP requests by bundling and minifying assets (CSS, JS).
-

2. Implement lazy loading for images and non-critical resources.
-

3. Use caching techniques (browser caching, server-side caching) to reduce server load.
-

4. Optimize database queries with proper indexing and efficient querying techniques.
-

5. Compress and optimize images to reduce file size without losing quality.
-

6. Implement pagination or infinite scrolling for large datasets.
-

7. Use a Content Delivery Network (CDN) to serve static assets from geographically distributed servers.
-

8. Minimize the use of blocking JavaScript and prioritize asynchronous operations.
-

9. Implement server-side rendering (SSR) for improved initial page load times.
-

These are some strategies I'm considering to optimize the performance of a web application.

Can anyone suggest additional techniques or share their experiences with optimizing web apps?

Join my Channels:
WhatsApp :
Telegram:

Follow me for more insightful content on System Design, JavaScript and MERN Technologies!

comments.commentText: This is a fantastic overview of web application optimization strategies! Your concise points are incredibly helpful, and I especially appreciate the linked resources. My team will definitely be using this!

postsData.commentAdded: Great strategies! Id also suggest monitoring performance with tools like Lighthouse and considering using Web Workers for heavy tasks. Lets optimize!

postsData.name:
G. Brent Barkin
G. Brent Barkin
postsData.content:
Post number 21 in the series:

Exciting developments in the 
hashtag
#recruitingNIL landscape, particularly in D1 men’s basketball. The proposed settlement agreement brings significant changes:

Starting 2025, D1 men’s basketball teams will have a 15-player roster cap with the option to offer up to 15 scholarships. Notably, basketball will transition to an equivalency sport. This shift grants coaches the flexibility to allocate these scholarships, whether as full or partial awards, aligning with their unique recruiting strategies.

Key points to note:
- Opt-In Schools: These institutions will adhere to the 15-player roster limit and 15 scholarships while partaking in the revenue-sharing system. Schools must declare their intent to opt in by March 1 annually, commencing in 2025.
- Opt-Out Schools: Programs opting out will maintain the current 13 scholarships model and can exceed the 15-player roster limit. However, by opting out, they forfeit participation in the revenue-sharing system, denying their athletes access to the yearly financial distribution.

The main implication seems to be for walk-on players. Being an "opt-out" program is not an option for the Power 5 schools. With 138 basketball programs (69 each for men's and women's), and a current average roster size of 15.7 this effectively means a loss of nearly 370 non-scholarship positions at Power 5 schools. Effectively, after this takes effect, there are will likely be no more walk-on positions at D1 Power 5 schools.

Other conferences will also find themselves at a competitive disadvantage for their bench and recruiting efforts if they don't follow suit, so it's very likely most of the 700 men's and women's D1 programs will cut the walk-on positions in lieu of all scholarship rosters.

Was anyone a walk-on at their school's program? Thoughts?

Also there is a non-equivalent GAIN of scholarship spots at these same schools. Let's discuss that in post #22.

For more details, check out the proposed changes at the link below:
postsData.commentAdded: This shift will certainly reshape the recruiting landscape! Interested to see how it impacts team dynamics and opportunities for aspiring athletes. 🏀

postsData.content:
Since when is basic humanity, optional? 


People are worried that AI is going to replace jobs,

but then are doing whatever they can to outsource their

- personality
- presence
- point of view
- relationships
- entire existence

When did this stop being fun and become just another chore for you?

Why do you think what you're doing is more important than someone else

who's actually taking the time to be there for you?

You are so starved for more attention that you're Ignoring the attention you're already getting!

You want me to show you how to get a viral post so you can see how absolutely useless it is?

Do you even understand why this platform is so broken?

Most people aren't here because they care about you. . .

they're here because they want you to care about them.

-> The algo wants your attention
-> The creators want your attention
-> The platform wants your attention

And each will do absolutely anything and everything they can to get it.

Can we all just stop living in the land of make believe?

If you're a real human, just respond with a  .

Yours truthfully,

Lauren Murrell
postsData.content:
Stop letting shyness and self-doubt steal your spotlight.
It's time to reprogram your mind.

When big opportunities appear,
our minds play tricks on us:

→ "I'll try when I'm more ready"
→ "I'm not experienced enough"
→ "Someone else would do it better"

But it doesn't have to be this way.
You can rewrite your story.

Practise these proven techniques 

1. Visualisation
→ Focus on feeling calm and in control
→ Picture yourself confidently handling social situations

2. Manifesting
→ Believe in your growth each day
→ Set affirmations like, “I am worthy of being heard”

3. Journaling
→ Write about times you felt confident
→ Track small wins to boost self-esteem

4. Mindful breathing
→ Breathe slowly to regain focus during self-doubt
→ Use deep breaths to calm nerves before interactions

5. Body language practice
→ Smile and use open gestures
→ Stand tall and maintain eye contact

6. Role-playing
→ Rehearse conversations with a friend
→ Focus on improving responses in tough situations

7. Gradual exposure
→ Start with simple social interactions
→ Gradually engage in more challenging ones

Confidence follows action.
Not the other way around.

What’s your best tip for overcoming self-doubt?
Let me know in the comments.

️ Repost to inspire confidence and courage
 Followfor more like this

comments.commentText:
Shyness won't take you far Lauren Murrell

Luckily, confidence can be built over the course of time
Blessing True

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! Embracing gradual exposure has really helped me. Small steps lead to big changes. Whats your favorite technique?

postsData.name:
Cristian Mudure
Cristian Mudure
postsData.content:
This week, the Danish Data Protection Authority announced that Danish companies must develop concrete plans to remove their organizations from Microsoft, Google, and AWS.

This decision comes in response to several members of the U.S. Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board (PCLOB) being asked to resign on the same day Trump took office.

From my perspective, there is nothing surprising about this, and it is the beginning of a predicted movement that will gradually take place in Germany and other European countries as well.

Thanks tofor pointing that out.

postsData.name:
Arjun Vaidya
Arjun Vaidya
postsData.content:
In 2012, I thought Gangnam Style was another viral trend. A decade later the K-wave has taken the way we eat, shops and have fun.

Growing up, I saw India embrace Chinese food, then Italian, even Japanese (still love my veg Sushi!).

But today, Korean is the new cool.

I recently learned that over 1.5 crore Indians consume Korean products. And, this transcends sectors:

1. The Entertainment Revolution

My dad (who never watched anything beyond news) is hooked to shows like Squid Game and All of Us Are Dead these days.

No surprise - K-drama craze that saw 370% viewership growth onduring COVID!

2. The Business Impact

When we invested in, I saw the potential combo of Korean culture Indianized. This has continued in K-Beauty brands seeing 50% growth on.

In entertainment, India has become the 6th highest consumer of K-pop globally.

The most interesting part for me is, Gen Zs across India are even speaking Korean!?!?

In Ahmedabad I even saw a Gen Z focussed non Korean brand casually use Korean words in their marketing.

3. The Food Evolution

Nowadays, I see Indian street vendors experimenting with Kimchi Dosas, Korean BBQ with Indian spices, and Gochujang-spiced curries. 

Just like we created our own version of Chinese food, Korean cuisine is getting its Indian makeover.

A quick commerce platform operator told me it’s 16% of noodle sales already!

I saw this fusion in action yesterday in @Knorr's new Korean Ramen TVC.

Gulshan Grover as the masked frontman from Squid Game - brought together India's 'Bad Man' with Korea's biggest show!

Just like in India, Korean culture celebrates joy through food, and brands like Knorr are bringing these cultures together beautifully.

The question isn't whether K-culture will stay. It's how we'll make it uniquely Indian. Because, in our country, Indianization works!

Which K-trends have you jumped on?

comments.commentText: Big fan of your content sir :)

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting to see K-culture thriving in India! The fusion of flavors and trends is truly inspiring. Cant wait to see how we’ll make it uniquely Indian! 🌟

postsData.name:
Ronen R. Pessar
Ronen R. Pessar
postsData.content:
“I’m not the best person” is 1 of 3 things 

(how to respond to each one)

1. 𝗬𝗼𝘂 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻

Simply ask for a referral:
"would {first name} be better to talk about {issue}?"

Offering a name makes it easy to hear: "Yes" or "No"
↳ path of least resistance

Asking them to GIVE YOU a name: is a big ask
↳ lots of resistance


2. 𝗧𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗺𝗶𝘀𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝘁𝗼𝗴𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿.

This is script feedback. It sounded,,,
→ unclear
→ generic
→ general

Easy fix!
↳ use more specific messaging
↳ cut out marketing jargon
↳ 5th grade level english

When this happens, call it out

️ “Ah, just want to make sure I have this right. You are the XXX {title} and deal with YYY {Issue}, or do I have the wrong person?”

^ that get's you back on track


𝟯. 𝗧𝗵𝗲𝘆'𝗿𝗲 𝗹𝘆𝗶𝗻𝗴.
(to get you off the phone)

This happens if your tone is "sales-y"

→ HOW you sounded
→ not WHAT you said

Reset the call with a label

️ “It seems like I just sounded salesl-y there and you might hate getting cold calls more than I hate making them… am I reading that right?”

The next time you hear:
"I'm not the best person"

First see what they mean,
...then handle it like a pro!

comments.commentText:
That first one is so clutch and especially if you take the burden off and come with a few names/suggestions!

Tom Slocum bet! the Hollyland mic is a game changer man
Your approach to handling objections is incredibly practical. Have you considered adding role-play exercises to reinforce these techniques?
Gevorg Harutyunyan appreciate that man! and yes definitely added that to my approach

postsData.commentAdded: Great insights! It’s crucial to clarify misunderstandings or reset the tone to build stronger connections in conversations. Thanks for sharing!

I have created a new masterclass for selling on LinkedIn. 


It's called TheGuide to Pitch Slapping.

This is a very special course because it's for common and also, uncommon vocations.

Here are just a few examples. . .

-> Ghostwriter: I loved your last post! Need some help creating better content?

-> Lead Gen Expert: Love what you're doing at {company}, you have great content. You must be getting a ton of leads from it? How's yourtreating you?

-> Life Coach: I love the vibe of your posts, your profile connects with me. I just wanted to reach out. How's life treating you at this very minute?

-> Proctologist: I love that you are building a foundation of kindness, and are not an asshole. Speaking of, does it hurt when you poop?

-> Lawyer: Hi, did you happen to see our billboard off of Route 80?

-> Psychologist: Hey there, I read your latest post. That was quite introspective. How did it make you feel to share that?

Financial Advisor: Hello, I wanted to see if I could assist you with the Apple Executive Compensation Plan including the Stock Plan. I work with tax minimization strategies with concentrated stock positions and help many such as your self with these strategies. During an initial call we could explore those.
**This message, and any attachments, is for the intended recipient(s) only, may contain information that is privileged, confidential and/or proprietary and subject to important terms and conditions available at. If you are not the intended recipient, please delete this message.

If you think of any cool ones for me to add to the course, please do leave them below.

postsData.name:
Dan Goodman
Dan Goodman
postsData.content:
Toxic bosses suck. They can ruin you life and your mental health. 

Do you work for a toxic boss? If you do, you deserve better. You should plan on getting the heck out as soon as you can.

Don’t stay stuck working in a toxic work environment. It can ruin your health both physically and mentally. Stress is a killer. Life is short. You deserve better.

Here are a few telltale signs of a toxic boss.
 No boundaries, you must be available on nights, weekends, and vacation
 Make you feel guilty for taking vacation time or parental leave
 Take credit for your work and don’t think twice about it
 Micromanage you to death - control and trust issues
 Promoted to role with no experience and no clue how to manage people
 Will throw you under the bus to deflect blame and protect themselves
 Will dismiss your ideas and bring them up later as their own
 Will sabotage you, gaslight you, undermine you with leadership

Toxic bosses are the number one reason people leave their employer. If you work in a toxic environment, I say don’t just quit. If you do you are giving your employer what they want.

Consider all your options and put together a plan to get out as soon as possible. Whether it is...

 taking a leave of absence
 getting a new job
 negotiating an exit
 quitting if left with no other choice

What is most important is you take action and not stay stuck in a bad situation that is harming you. Take action.

comments.commentText: Worked for a toxic manager and reported to HR. After few months, my position was eliminated.
Zara Smith thank you Zara. I’m in a better place.

In my opinion although all are relevant, the one on micromanagement and trust is a really big one. I cannot tell you how many people join a new company and seem shocked they are working for a micro manager.

You need to do deep and wide character checks on the person who will be managing you before you join up.

Look deeply before you leap!!

postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely! Taking action is crucial. Remember, your well-being always comes first. Don’t let a toxic boss dictate your future! 🌟

postsData.name:
Michael Walker Ed.D.
Michael Walker Ed.D.
postsData.content:
𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝗳 𝘀𝘂𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗽𝗿i𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻 𝗯𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝗮𝘁 𝗮 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲?

On clear winter mornings in Mexico City, where I grew up, we could see a snow-capped 𝗣𝗼𝗽𝗼𝗰𝗮𝘁é𝗽𝗲𝘁𝗹 looming in the distance. Years later, as a college student, I climbed the volcano.

It was tough. 𝗪𝗲 𝗵𝗮𝗱 𝗮 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻, but as we neared the peak, we encountered ice. We had to decide whether to continue on the same path or adjust our route.

Then, a couple of teammates started showing signs of altitude sickness. 𝗔𝗻𝗼𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻—maintain our pace, slow down, or turn back?

𝗘𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆 𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗽 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗮 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻.

𝗦𝗲𝘁𝗵 𝗚𝗼𝗱𝗶𝗻 𝗱𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝘆 𝗮𝘀 𝗮 𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 that helps people and organizations anticipate change and set direction rather than follow a rigid plan.

Strategic planning, then, isn’t about predicting the future—𝗶𝘁’𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗶𝗰𝗲𝘀 in the moment and 𝗮𝗱𝗮𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝘀 𝗰𝗶𝗿𝗰𝘂𝗺𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝗲𝘃𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗲.

This aligns with 𝗞𝗮𝗶𝘇𝗲𝗻, the Japanese principle of 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁—progress happens 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗰𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘁 𝗮 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 through small, intentional actions.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻:
Have a dream 
Have a clear sense of direction 
Make incremental decisions 
Gather information as you progress 
Adjust as circumstances change 
Manage momentum ️
Celebrate progress 

𝗦𝘂𝗰𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗶𝘀𝗻’𝘁 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝘀𝘄𝗲𝗿𝘀—i𝘁’𝘀 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗱, 𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝘁 𝗮 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗱𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗺? 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘃𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻? 𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗯𝗶𝗴 𝗴𝗼𝗮𝗹?
More importantly—𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗱𝗲𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲? Drop it in the comments, or DM me. Let’s talk.

postsData.name:
🔥 Tom Slocum
🔥 Tom Slocum
postsData.content:
Your prospects dont want another email. They want a face

Text based outreach is everywhere

Emails. LinkedIn DMs. Cold calls

But heres what the top performing sales teams are doing differently: They’re using video

And the data proves it

 Video creation is up 88%
 GTM teams are making 241% more videos per month
 AI powered video tools have skyrocketed 12x

(Source: Vidyard’s 2025 video in business report)

But heres the problem…

Most reps still arent using it

And the ones that are? They’re closing more deals

Why? Because video makes you real

• It builds trust faster than text
• It gets higher response rates than plain emails
• It turns cold outreach into a warm connection

I used to overthink video too

 “I don’t like being on camera”
 “What if I mess up?”
 “It feels awkward”

But then I realized something. My competitors were using it. And they were winning

So I stopped overthinking it

I found a tool that made it stupidly simple () hit record and never looked back

Now? My teams videos have a 70-80% watch rate and drive real pipeline

Video isnt a “nice to have” anymore. Its the cheat code

Are you using video in your sales process yet? If not whats holding you back?

𝗣.𝗦. Huge shoutout to&at Sendspark for constantly improving the game. Their latest UI updates make video creation easier than ever

Email has become an abyss. Irrelevant in reality. Its noisy. But pick up that phone or shoot that video? Pshhh you separate yourself immediately!

postsData.name:
Zachary Wright MBA
Zachary Wright MBA
postsData.content:
The loudest voices hyping up these "beloved tools" aren’t the ones stuck using them every day.

A different tool for every. single. thing.
Yet somehow, work still feels harder.

- 2.5 hours wasted daily just searching for information. (Asana, 2023)
- 74% of employees waste time switching between apps. (RingCentral, 2024)
- The average worker juggles 9+ apps daily just to do their job. (HBR, 2024)

If these tools were really solving work, why is it still so broken?

Spoiler: The people shouting the loudest about Notion, Slack, Teams, Salesforce, Google Drive and more?

They’re not the ones living in the chaos.

[] Consultants profit off selling them.
[] Tech influencers get paid to promote them.
[] Investors push them to boost valuations.

Meanwhile, employees are drowning in fragmented systems, disconnected conversations, and endless app-switching—just to find what they need.

This isn’t work. This is a digital scavenger hunt.

At, we’re done with the noise.

One place for everything your team needs.
No more bouncing between 10+ apps.
No more wasted hours searching.

We’re not here to debate work. We’re here to fix it.

Our RTROW Virtual Event is happening this Tuesday.

Come see what work should actually look like.
 February 4th @ 12PM EST
 Register in the comments.

What’s the most useless tool your company makes you use? Drop it below.
postsData.commentAdded: Absolutely spot on! Its time to streamline and focus on efficiency. Looking forward to the RTROW Virtual Event! What a game changer this could be!

postsData.content: So many companies focus on past experience while overlooking the potential for growth and the importance of soft skills. Hiring for the future, as you say, is key to building a successful team.

comments.commentText:
Spot on! A CV tells you where someone has been, but their mindset tells you where they can go. 

In today’s fast-evolving business landscape, adaptability, problem-solving, and a growth mindset often outweigh years of experience. The most successful teams are built not just on past achievements, but on the potential to learn, innovate, and thrive in the face of change.

Hiring for the future isn’t just a strategy—it’s a necessity.
